author: stefan2
msg: On the authzperf branch:  Switch authz code from svn_config_t to using the
The changes in this patch fall into three categories.  First, adapt and
greatly simplify data extraction from the full model.  Secondly, update
bits of the interface code to construct a next-gen model instance instead
of a config object.  And finally, remove large chunks of obsolete code,
mainly verification and group / rule config fusion.  Both are covered by
get_group_memberships): Drop.  Alias handling and group flattening code
is already covered by the tng data model.
(get_memberships): Update to new data model - just iterate over all flat
process_rule): Drop. ACEs are directly accessible in the tng model.
(has_matching_rule): Update to new data model - just iterate over all
ACEs and handle generic ACEs as well.
(process_acl): ... this.  Operate on a single ACL instead of a config
(create_user_authz): Consume the new data model now and iterate directly
authz_config_validate): Drop validation code. Functionality is
already covered by the tng model parser.
(svn_authz_t): The full data model is now the next-gen one.
authz_copy_groups): Drop group / rule file fusion code.  Functionality
is already covered by the tng model parser.
(create_authz): Accept the tng model instead of svn_config_t.
svn_repos_authz_parse): Construct the tng model instead of svn_config_t.
